summary: This is a letter from defense attorneys Foy & SepLowitz LLC to the US Attorney's Office regarding the case US v. Tova Noel, et al. It requests extensive information and materials related to the video surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including details about system failures, maintenance, and specific video footage of Epstein and the defendants.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Named defendant in the criminal case US v. Tova Noel, et al. The letter requests video evidence related to her alleged conduct and failure to perform inmate counts at the MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The letter requests video surveillance footage of him, including from before and after his alleged suicide attempt in July 2019 and from the day of his death.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Named defendant (first name only provided) in the case. The letter requests video evidence of her alleged conduct and conversations on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jason E. Foy
persons.context: Attorney from Foy & SepLowitz LLC who authored and signed the letter. He is corresponding with the US Attorney's Office regarding discovery in the case.

persons.name: Officer -1
persons.context: An unnamed corrections officer referenced in the indictment. The letter asks for video evidence showing this officer and Tova Noel did not perform a 4pm inmate count.

connections.description: Jason Foy is a defense attorney representing defendant Tova Noel, as indicated by the letter being addressed on her behalf and copied to her.
Both are defendants in the same criminal case (US v. Tova Noel, et al.) related to events at the MCC.
Tova Noel was a corrections officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Jeffrey Epstein was housed.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking extensive discovery on the MCC's video surveillance system, including details about its installation, maintenance, failures, and replacement around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The letter references specific alleged misconduct by defendants Tova Noel and Thomas, including failing to perform inmate counts, sleeping on duty, and browsing the internet.
A key request is for all video footage containing Jeffrey Epstein, including from his alleged suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and from before/after that event.
The defense highlights system failures on July 29, 2019, and August 8, 2019, and the replacement of the entire system on or about August 12, 2019.
The correspondence indicates the defense is preparing for trial in the case against the corrections officers, focusing on challenging the video evidence of their alleged negligence.
